data.question: What is the chemical formula of the mixed-valence metal-organic framework discussed in the article?
What method was used for the synthesis of Fe(1,2,3-triazolate)2(BF4)0.22?
data.answer: A purple solution of thianthrenium tetrafluoroborate in MeCN was added to Fe(tri)2 and stirred at 25 °C for 16 h.

data.question: What was the yield percentage for the synthesis of Fe(1,2,3-triazolate)2(BF4)0.09?
What technique was used to collect high-resolution X-ray powder diffraction data?
data.answer: Data was collected at Beamline 17-BM-B at the Advanced Photon Source (APS) at Argonne National Laboratory.

data.question: What was the purpose of using a constant acceleration spectrometer in Mössbauer spectroscopy?
data.answer: To record zero-field, Fe-57 Mössbauer spectra between room temperature and 5 K.

data.question: How was the electrical conductivity of the sample measured?
data.answer: Through both I-V measurements and electrochemical impedance spectroscopy using a Bio-Logic VMP-3 multipotentiostat.

data.question: What was the room-temperature conductivity of Fe(tri)2(BF4)0.33?
What was the Debye temperature obtained from the temperature dependence of the Mössbauer spectral parameters?
What was the method used to calculate the theoretical surface area of Fe(tri)2(BF4)0.33?
data.answer: Using the open-source software Zeo++ version 0.36 accessible through Lawrence Berkeley Laboratory (LBNL).

data.question: What was the main finding regarding the conductivity of Fe(tri)2(BF4)x as a function of x?
data.answer: The room-temperature conductivity values of Fe(tri)2(BF4)x were fit to a model describing the doping dependence of conductivity for Mott insulators with polaronic hopping transport.

data.question: Is the conductivity of Fe(tri)2(BF4)x dependent on the doping level x?
Was the oxidation of Fe(tri)2 saturated through the insertion of 0.33 BF4- anion?
Did the Fe2 site participate in the electron delocalization according to the Mössbauer spectral parameters?
Was the variable-temperature conductivity measurement performed using a Quantum Design MPMS2 SQUID magnetometer?
Is the observed conductivity of 0.3(1) S/cm for Fe(tri)2(BF4)0.33 among the highest for three-dimensionally conducting metal-organic frameworks?
Does the article suggest that Fe(tri)2(BF4)x exhibits a high degree of charge delocalization between octahedral low-spin iron(II) and iron(III) centers?
Was the activation energy for charge hopping in Fe(tri)2(BF4)0.33 found to be constant across all temperatures?
Did the study find that the conductivity of Fe(tri)2(BF4)x increases with increasing x due to increasing carrier concentration?
Was the study able to unequivocally determine the unitless constant c and the saturation level xsat simultaneously?
Does the study conclude that special caution is imperative when handling and studying the conductivity of redox-active metal-organic frameworks?
